website_summaries.verdict: This coolers has a nice size, strong hinges, and easy-to-carry handles.
pros: The handles are hinged to hang at the side of the cooler, but extend above the lid for more comfortable carrying
Cooler is designed to double as a seat, supporting up to 250 pounds
Can keep ice cold for up to five days
cons: Does not include an internal strap to keep the lid from overextending

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: After more than a full day in Arizona with temperatures in the mid 90's during the day and with the cooler exposed to the full sunwe still had a cooler full of ice. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: DavidP

customer_reviews.title: What's a YETI???
customer_reviews.text: We were prepared to buy a YETI, but kept watching videos of side-by-side tests of coolers, and weren't excited about always worrying that someone was going to steal a $400 cooler out of our car or campsite. After months of research, we bought this. It Works Great!!! This was about $50, and keeps things cold for days! Now we don't feel like we have to chain our cooler to our vehicle to keep it from being stolen :-D
customer_reviews.author: Irene U.

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Extreme Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Used once. Not overly impressed but better than a regular cooler. Decent value for the money. The question in buying these new, high tech coolers is how much ice will you have to buy to make up for the additional money spent on a Yeti or Cold Bastard. Nearly 400 less than top of the line Yeti and a quarter of the price of a Cold Bastard. Good seller. Prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Worst coleman cooler ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst coleman cooler ever. Nothing about this is "xtreme" other than it's extremely poor at keeping things cold and ice, ice.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Traxler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold ice
customer_reviews.text: We were very disappointed in our first use with this cooler. We had food to keep cold and hoped to not have to leave our family or rely on someone else to get ice repeatedly while camping over 3 days. That was not the case. It was in the 80's in Michigan and our food was floating in water within the first 24 hours. The plastic hinges are flimsy and sure to break, which is what happened with our previous coleman wheeled cooler. We intend to return. Sorry Coleman, we're not coming back...
customer_reviews.author: average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money - doesn’t hold ice
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed especially after reading the positive reviews. Doesn’t hold ice for 12 hours before completely melting. I would return but it was outside of the return window before we had a chance to use it. Our 10 year old generic cooler held ice better than this. Sad that we wasted the money and now have to find another cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Intex Floating Cooler Tube Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect fit for the Intex Mega Chill II. It's just a bit deeper and wider than the standard Coleman cooler, but the difference is this holds 100 cans and the standard holds 70 cans. It's well built and better insulated than most coolers. Will easily hold ice for 3 days when properly packed.
customer_reviews.author: digitalcraftsman

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy another
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for almost 3 years now and it has stood up to some abuse, excellent quality for the money, keeps ice over the weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: We bought this one as it was similar to cooler we already had - as long as it is packed properly- it will keep items cool as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We needed an extra cooler for the summer and Coleman products are reliable. We bought this one as it was similar to cooler we already had - as long as it is packed properly- it will keep items cool as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Meli

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooler and perfect size for a weekend of camping
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cooler and perfect size for a weekend of camping. Seems very sturdy and well built and keeps ice a long time. Not as long as a Yeti of RTIC, but certainly longer than other budget coolers. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Keeps frozen stuff frozen
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is perfect for me. I purchase cases of frozen dog food and have to keep it frozen for about an hour or two and this cooler does a great job. It is also light weight and easily portable.
customer_reviews.author: animaldr

customer_reviews.title: This is the best cooler I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cooler I have owned. It kept ice for 5 days as advertised in the hot West Texas desert.
customer_reviews.author: T. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a two person carrying job when full but the end handles are strong and large so it’s not so bad to share the load
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for taking one cooler to camp. Doesn’t come with a basket insert, though. I miss that feature. Definitely a two person carrying job when full but the end handles are strong and large so it’s not so bad to share the load.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Bad hinges
customer_reviews.text: The hinges for the lid are week. The screws came off after just the third use.
customer_reviews.author: Rumy Jaleel-khan

customer_reviews.title: Love this. After 4 days of camping
customer_reviews.text: Love this. After 4 days of camping...my gallons jugs of Ice were still frozen.
customer_reviews.author: GAMamaw

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy yeti
customer_reviews.text: Never owned or want to own a Yeti, their just not worth it. Coleman makes a great cooler that will hold ice as long as needed and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schowengerdt

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight. Smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Will hold a bag of ice and a case of drinks. Not much else.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Daxton

customer_reviews.title: Keeps ice for 5 days plus!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps ice for DAYS! I did put one block ice in and there were still ice cubes a week later! Very impressed. The only concerns I have are the cheap hinges (replaceable) and if the handles are going to break when loaded with 70# of ice and food. It did what I bought it for--keeping ice from melting while on a 5 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Rickey

customer_reviews.title: Took it hunting, it did it's job very well.
customer_reviews.text: given the cost relative to Yeti/Otterbox coolers, this cooler is FANTASTIC. Keeps ice for well over a weekend, even when it's sunny out.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Brinloe

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a weeklong camping trip. Didn't have to add ice until day three, kept everything super cold. It's large enough that all our food (dinners for two for five nights) fit, as well as plenty of cans of beer and soda. Highly recommended, will probably purchase a second one to replace the older one I have.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Took it camping and it stayed cold. I wanted a cooler a bit larger than what I had, and this one is a good balance of size versus lifting by one person.
customer_reviews.author: tnscoutr

customer_reviews.title: no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I have a coleman cooler, which I am pleased with so I bought this one for my daughter and her husband as they were always borrowing ours.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler for the money
customer_reviews.text: I go camping most weekends in Florida during the summer, Fri, Sat and Sun, I use a mixture of block and cube ice and almost always am dumping out ice when I get home. No need to spend hundreds of dollars on a Yeti. Plus it is light and I can easily move and carry it when full.
customer_reviews.author: MPW

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the price
customer_reviews.text: Keeps ice for several days. Also sturdy enough to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanina Maggioli

customer_reviews.title: Quality control
customer_reviews.text: one hinge was screwed on misaligned (would have to fill the factory holes and drill again/mount again for hinge lock open/hold feature to work).
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: Holds ice really well. We used it for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds ice really well. We used it for a weekend of camping in the summer heat and even with getting in and out for meals it still held ice for a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: eldyn90

customer_reviews.title: ice chest
customer_reviews.text: didn't have a seal and packets of ice melted to quickly and was too big
customer_reviews.author: lawrence benson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got it as an extra seat for boat. Strong and everything it claims seeems to be holding true.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis J Sturdivant

customer_reviews.title: Kept food safe at Burning Man (100+ degrees)
customer_reviews.text: Kept things cold. Used at Burning Man. Needed ice every other day, but it was over 100 degrees the full week.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weal

customer_reviews.title: Great Insulation
customer_reviews.text: One bag of ice kept everything cold for over 5 days. Worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Lid didn't catch
customer_reviews.text: Probably a great cooler but when the lid doesn't stay closed it's a problem and there's no latch or mechanism to hold it closed; it's intended to be a pressure fit.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: This cooler is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cooler for a family trip in National Parks. This cooler kept all our drinks and food so cold. We were impressed when ice keeping things cold lasted 2 full days in over 90 degree weather. Love this cooler. Best one we have purchased ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B Spitzer

customer_reviews.title: Decent cooler
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to. Pretty good size for whatever you need to bring a cooler to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice color too
customer_reviews.text: A real party pleaser! Kept 36 cans of soda ice cold, on one of the hottest days of the summer. Nice color too!
customer_reviews.author: Loomer

customer_reviews.title: Held ice for 6 days
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cooler, I used it for hunt camp to store food. It held ice for 6 days.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sherrill II

customer_reviews.title: Hate to spend $$$ for a Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Really wish it held ice longer. Also wish I had the box to send it back for a refund. Hate to spend $$$ for a Yeti, or other high end cooler, but if you want your ice to last in Arizona, you need too.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The handles make it very difficult to carry this cooler on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Enxing

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I had misgivings when I saw this cooler, the walls are so thin I suspected it would be a poor insulator. However, during a two-week road trip in hot weather, it proved to be great. The size is particularly right for a family of four. Using a square of block ice to separate dairy/meat from veggies with a bag of crushed on top turned out to be the best system.
customer_reviews.author: capucine

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: 6 ice blocks, 10 lbs of chipped ice and yet everything was cold 5 days later. Well worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: If I had the option for no stars that's what ...
customer_reviews.text: If I had the option for no stars that's what I would give this thing. Doesn't keep ice for more than about 8 hours in any temp above 80 degrees. Totally not worth the money and seems to be misrepresented on this site.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Betts

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooler as seen here ! When I received my cooler it was not even close to what it looks like !!
customer_reviews.author: Gmann

customer_reviews.title: Not a knock on the actual product, but rather the product description and picture provided by seller 'Red's Gear'
customer_reviews.text: I ordered what I thought was the Coleman Xtreme 70 Qt cooler pictured on this page. Mainly because I liked the look of the cooler vs the typical look of the Xtreme coolers. What I received was a cooler that I could purchase at Wal-Mart for less than $40. It was an Xtreme cooler, but not the one pictured on this page. Amazon issued a prompt refund, which I'm happy about. Kudos to Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Picardi

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 4 day camping trip & it really worked. Kept my food cold the whole trip. I never had to purchase any extra ice.
customer_reviews.author: Deb N.

product_meta.title: Coleman 70-Quart Xtreme 5-Day Heavy-Duty Cooler
product_meta.description: Keep beverages and perishable foods cold with the Coleman 70-Quart Xtreme 5-Day Heavy-Duty Cooler. Ideal for weekend camping adventures, barbecues, and road trips, this portable cooler features Xtreme insulation technology that keeps ice up to 5 days in temperatures as high as 90°F. With enough capacity for up to 100 cans, the cooler provides ample space for ingredients, perishable food, drinks, and more. The leak-resistant drain allows you to easily empty excess water without tilting the cooler. Integrated cup holders on the lid offer easy access to cold drinks, while the Have-A-Seat lid offers a comfortable place to sit and relax. When it is time to pack up, the EZ-Clean lid easily wipes clean of grime and dirt. And thanks to its comfortable, no-crush handle grips, this portable cooler is easy to carry and minimizes strain and pinching on your hands.
feature_bullets: Well-insulated portable cooler ideal for camping, barbecues, and road trips
Insulated lid and walls provide up to 5 days of ice retention in temperatures as high as 90°F
Cup holders molded into the lid for easy access to beverages
No-crush handle grips allow for comfortable, controlled lifting and carrying
Holds 100 cans—more than four cases of soda fit inside a 70-quart cooler
No-Crush Comfort Handles for easy, pinch-free carrying
Hinged lid with four molded cup holders helps prevent spills and keeps drinks close
Have-A-Seat Lid supports up to 250 lbs. (113.4 kg) for a place to sit and rest
Retextured EZ-Clean top for quick, easy washing
Xtreme 5 Technology keeps ice up to 5 days in temperatures up to 90° F (32.22⁰ C)
ThermOZONE Insulation contains no CFCs, HFCs or HCFCs, which deplete the ozone

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
